title: Another very Univers-ish face (Yokoland)
content:
Another ID for a very Univers-ish typeface. Used alot in book-designs by Norwegian Yokoland.  
Thank you

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [f134-l.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015114901/http:/typophile.com/files/f134-l.jpg) | 148.77 KB |
author: sondre m

comments.content:
It looks like **[Gothic 725 (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015114901/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Bitstream&ffam=Gothic725%20Bd%20BT%20-%20Bold&fid=1de15edd22e1f96768be1fab0fc35869&fsize=60&text=Lotta%20Elstad%20Ettromsleiligheten&wrap=2)** by Günter Gerhard Lange (Bitstream, 1990)

-----------------------------------------------  
I found it using Find my Font - [http://www.findmyfont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015114901/http:/www.findmyfont.com/ "http://www.findmyfont.com")

You are basically right Jan, it could perfectly be **[Akzidenz Grotesk (Medium)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015114901/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Berthold&ffam=Akzidenz-Grotesk%20BQ%20-%20Medium&fid=a05e72957b7c00d0f15d20fb63688f19&fsize=48&text=Lotta%20Elstad%20Ettromsleiligheten&wrap=2)**.  
The only difference I notice is that Gothic 725 Bold is a bit lighter and more narrow (condensed) which makes it somewhat closer to the sample image.
Wow, I can't belive the type-community isn't full of copyright-lawsuits. Thanks to both of you!

The US does not have copyright protection for typeface designs, only font software.

hhp
Do other countries have copyright protection for typeface designs?

Yes, many European countries do.

hhp
